Experience Local Merchant Operations Associate Google Via Cognizant July 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Google West Campus Working as a vendor for initially Vaco and then Cognizant in November 2014, I work as Tier three technical support in the Global Business department of Google to assist users with Google Maps, Google My Business & Google+ Local support. In addition, I provide Quality Assurance (QA) checks on my colleagues both in Tier three and Tier two support. Finally, I diagnose and report on technical issues within the Google My Business product. Recreational Leader The City of Lafayette June 2008  –  July 2014  (6 years 2 months) Lafayette, California Since high school I worked at the City’s recreation camp for children ages 4 to 12 (some with special needs) whenever I was available during summers and holidays. I both valued and enjoyed the communication and multitasking challenges that came with working with small children, their parents, and co-workers. My office responsibilities also required knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Office.  Marketing Intern Make-A-Wish America September 2013  –  December 2013  (4 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area While working as a marketing intern for the national office of this nonprofit I focused on the social media and market research aspect of the firm. I reported to two different individuals, working a total of 20 hours a week. My responsibilities included assisting with tasks associated with our social media sites, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ and Pinterest, as well as performing various types of market research in regards to our sponsors. Community Assistant Arizona State University August 2012  –  May 2013  (10 months) Tempe, AZ As a community leader on the floor, I helped transition the incoming freshman into their new college lives. I achieved this goal by providing support both academically and emotionally, and by involving them in their community through various events and programs planned with my fellow coworkers.  
 
It is a privilege to have held this highly competitive and honorable position at the University. As the ASU website (http://housing.asu.edu/content/student-employment) states, "The Community Assistant position is often referred to as one of the most challenging and rewarding leadership roles an undergraduate can pursue."  Marketing Intern Engenuity Systems February 2012  –  May 2013  (1 year 4 months) Chandler, Arizona Working 20 hours a week during the school term for this Value Added Reseller (VAR) of control products and solutions, I initially reported to the Marketing Manager, and now report directly to the head of Sales. My responsibilities include managing multiple forms of social media, such as Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, and company Web Pages, as well as writing press releases, doing market research, and analyzing customer behavior.
